item.title: Mathematical analysis in several variables: Part 1 - Functions of several variables, level curves and limits.
item.description: Introduction Analysis of one variable is very powerful, but most of the time, functions will have several variables. This series will cover analysis in several variables. Formal definition Let’s properly define what a function of several variables is A function of two variables is a rule that associates to each pair, $(x, y)$ of real numbers, in a set, $D$, a unique number denoted as, $f(x, y)$. $D$ is the so-called domain.
